bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to James G. Cumming, December 18, 1920

div1.p: Laura A. Carter informs Cumming that Henry Carter is in Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to James G. Cumming, December 18, 1920
div1.opener:
Y. F.
request for reprint
The Lonsdale, Apt. 206,
Washington, D. C.,
Dec.18/20.
Lt. Colonel James G. Cumming,
Medical Corps, U. S. A.,
Army Medical School,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Colonel Cumming:
div1.p:
Your letter to my Father, Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
has just been forwarded to me here.

Father left last winter for Peru, S. A., where he is serving as
Sanitary Advisor to the Peruvian Government--the chief cause for his
going being the yellow fever epidemic in the Piura District in
northern Peru--now fortunately suppressed. We are expecting him in
Washington on “the first steamer sailing after December 31, 1920.” I
trust there is one on New Years Day!

In regard to the article on the distribution and control of
yellow fever in the Southern Medical for December, its publication
was through General Lyster long after Father's departure and I re-
gret to say that, up to date, we have received no reprints. It
gives me much pleasure, however, to enclose Father's reprint on
“The Mechanism of the Spontaneous Elimination of Yellow Fever from
Endemic Centres.”

If I can be of any further service to you, I shall consider it
a privelege.
